googleCloudRunner 0.0.9002

Deploy a Dockerfile so it will be built on ContainerRegistry

cr_deploy_docker.Rd

If no Dockerfile present in the deployment folder, will attempt to create a Dockerfile to upload via cr_dockerfile

cr_deploy_docker(local, image_name = remote, dockerfile = NULL,
  remote = basename(local), tag = "$BUILD_ID", timeout = 600L,
  bucket = cr_bucket_get(), projectId = cr_project_get(),
  launch_browser = interactive(), task_id = NULL)

Arguments

local

The folder containing the Dockerfile to build
image_name

The name of the docker image to be built either full name starting with gcr.io or constructed from the image_name and projectId via gcr.io/{projectId}/{image_name}
dockerfile

An optional Dockerfile built to support the script. Not needed if 'Dockerfile' exists in folder. If supplied will be copied into deployment folder and called "Dockerfile"
remote

The folder on Google Cloud Storage
tag

The tag to attached to the pushed image - can use Build macros
timeout

Amount of time that this build should be allowed to run, to second
bucket

The GCS bucker that will be used to deploy code source
projectId

The projectId
launch_browser

Whether to launch the logs URL in a browser once deployed
task_id

RStudio job task_id if you want to use the same task

Examples



# NOT RUN {
cr_deploy_docker(system.file("example", package="googleCloudRunner"))

# }

Contents
